result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Travon Edwards

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darryl Travon Edwards not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Darryl Travon Edwards. Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Clerk previously made arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom for today's hearing; however, Defendant was not produced via Zoom. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided notice to the Court regarding expert testimony. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

-signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided information to MCSO. 

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office shall make immediate and appropriate accommodations at the Criminal Justice Facility, 949 North 9th Street in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, to allow Defendant Darryl Edwards the opportunity to review non-paper/electronic discovery placed in his property by Attorney Theodore O'Reilly of the Law Offices of the Wisconsin State Public Defender.

The property shall take the form of attachments to email and/or links containing the complete electronic discovery in the above case, including, but not limited to, video. Mr. Edwards has a constitutional right to review all matters associated with his case.

Mr. Edwards shall be allowed 24 hours in total to review his discovery, with review sessions divided into reasonable increments subject to the needs of the Sheriff's Office.

Defendant Darryl Travon Edwards appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Darryl Travon Edwards.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update to the Courts regarding investigation and requested one more status hearing. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Status hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Darryl Travon Edwards not in court, in custody  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant was not produced for hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has received Discovery materials. Defense requested a Status hearing. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Status hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 9:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Darryl Travon Edwards in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Darryl Travon Edwards in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective O. Phillips. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl Travon Edwards not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with M.A.W. E.A.W, T.M.B, T.D.W., J.L.M, and D.L.B
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Darryl Travon Edwards in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Darryl Travon Edwards in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
